In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can write the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cras sollicitudin nulla at sapien pretium, in mollis turpis feugiat."
println(wrap_string(str))
```

This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, 
consectetur adipiscing elit. 
Cras sollicitudin nulla at 
sapien pretium, in mollis turpis 
feugiat.
```
